notes: This file defines house style for prose generation and revision.
No EM Dashes. Do not use U+2014. Prefer comma, period, or colon. En dash U+2013 allowed only for numeric ranges and dates.
Voice is human, lean, and local to Greywater. Concrete over abstract. Rhythm over rhetoric.

punctuation_rules.semicolon_policy: Rare. Use only to join two short, closely linked independents.
punctuation_rules.colon_policy: Allowed for definitions or lists. Do not overuse for drama.
punctuation_rules.ellipsis_policy: Avoid except for interrupted dialogue or genuine trailing thought. Max one per chapter.
punctuation_rules.exclamation_policy: Max one per chapter, dialogue only.

register_and_voice.person: third-limited primary (Ivy). Secondary limited allowed for short beats with Kestrel, Tamsin, or Rooke.
register_and_voice.contractions: Use natural contractions (it's, don't, can't). Avoid stiff formality.
register_and_voice.tone: grounded, attentive, unsentimental, with brief dry humor under stress.
narration_rules: Prefer direct perception. Replace filter verbs like 'she saw' with the thing seen when context is clear.
No head hopping within a scene. Switch PoV only on a clear scene break.
Describe with civic materials and rhythms: lamps, rails, bells, tide, paper, brass, chalk, salt.

figurative_language.metaphor_rule: A metaphor must make the mechanism clearer or sharpen emotion. If it merely decorates, cut it.

structure_constraints.list_rules: Bulleted lists only for in-world artifacts, rules, or checklists. Not for narrative beats.
narrative_flow: Goal - obstacle - turn within each scene.
End on image, choice, or reversal. No recap endings.

transition_rules.frequency_note: Do not start more than two consecutive sentences with the same transition.

banned_fillers: it is important to note that
at the end of the day
banned_phrases_regex: let out a breath (?:she|he|they|I) (?:didn't|did not) know (?:she|he|they|I) was holding

lamplight: the halo tightened into a coin
light sat steady rather than bright
glass fogged, then cleared on her breath
fog: the city kept its voice low
bell: the strike landed a hair late
the echo stepped ahead of the sound
a clean ring like a ladle on porcelain
rails_and_trolley: the line hummed under the skin of the air
sparks stitched blue at the switch
water_and_tide: river slap counted the seconds wrong
paper_and_brass: brass kept the warmth of a hand
dog: his ears set like little sails to wind
he went still, and the room listened with him

dialogue_rules.tag_policy: Use said and asked. Fancy tags rare. Use action beats to attribute speakers.
dialogue_rules.beat_frequency: Insert a physical beat at least every 3-4 lines to anchor bodies in space.
dialogue_rules.punctuation: Keep punctuation simple. No exclamation marks outside dialogue.

problems: Overly formal register, evasive tone, no contractions
Stock positivity and canned uplift at paragraph ends
counters: Force contractions; add one grounded detail per paragraph (object, smell, texture)
Have the narrator pick a side through selection of detail, not editorials
End paragraphs on image, action, or choice, not advice
Begin in scene; skip thesis statements
Use lists only for in-world artifacts and procedures
Replace formal transitions with time-place beats or motion
Pull from the bible files: magic_rules, props_artifacts, setting_catalog
Prefer concrete civic detail over summary
Vary sentence starts with prepositional and participial openers sparingly
Limit to one clean simile per scene in on-brand domains

problems: Flawless polish that ignores human breath
counters: Bake in breath counts and micro-actions
Tie each claim to a physical cue or a logged artifact

regex_tests_for_linter.banned_beginnings: ^(In the world of|In today's fast-paced world|The concept of|In recent years)
regex_tests_for_linter.empty_phrases: (it is important to note that|in order to|due to the fact that|in an effort to|ever-evolving landscape|unlock the potential|harness the power of|delve into|navigate the complexities of)

openers: Concrete image + motion within the first two sentences.
A small physical problem that hints at the seam or the scene goal.
closers: A physical image that tilts the chapter into the next one.
A paid-off motif beat (halo tightens to round, bell clears, salt ring break opened toward home).

motif_alignment.note: Mark chosen motifs at the top of each chapter file for continuity.

good_lines: The lamp's halo tightened into a coin as her breath found the count.
Chalk dust ghosted her fingers. The lattice held.
The bell sounded woolly in fog, then, a breath later, clean as porcelain.

bad_lines_and_reasons.text: In today's fast-paced world, it is important to note that lamplighters must navigate the complexities of seam management.
bad_lines_and_reasons.reason: Corporate intro, empty phrases, banned transition.

bad_lines_and_reasons.text: Suddenly, she realized that she had let out a breath she didn't know she was holding.
